Title: Cultivated meat, Coldiretti's assault on the interministerial table
Description:
On the street there were signs with high -sounding slogans such as "food from the countryside not from the workshops", "more medical research", "European citizens are not guinea pigs". The request of the Association - which the scientific community considers without foundation - is to put synthetic meat and drugs on the same level, imposing "clinical and preclinical studies" before putting on the market.

The researchers' response: "The request for farmers has no scientific basis"

In a letter sent to Coldiretti by a group of scientists who collaborate with the European Agency, the thesis of the farmers is in fact dismantled: "The event of Coldiretti in Parma in front of the headquarters of the European Authority for food safety (EFSA) - reads the letter - represents a worrying attempt to delegitimize the work of the independent scientific community and the European regulatory framework on the new foods, among the most rigorous in the world. Of the existing scientific literature and the research that we have already conducted, we feel that the current regulatory framework does not present critical issues and that the request for clinical and preclinical studies has no scientific basis. Note, while EFSA can only approve in the absence of health risks ".

The freedom of choice of consumers is at risk

Coldiretti's declared goal is to obtain greater checks on the approval processes of the so -called novelty foods, which would also include those on the meat produced in the laboratory. A meat that - revealing a certain ignorance on the subject - is defined by the "synthetic meat" detractors, when synthetic actually has nothing. The term is used as a dialectical weapon to induce to think of a "fake" product and harmful to the body.

The arm wrestling on the ban on cultivated meat Francesco Lollobrigida (Getty)

The not declared, but easily intuitive, goal is to prevent citizens (one tomorrow) from being able to choose a product obtained without killing animals and without financing those intensive farms that - those yes - increase production by inflicting atrocious suffering to the beasts using antibiotics and feed not really healthy. In fact, Coldiretti invokes medical research but there is very little in its scientific disputes. And the purpose of this mobilization is to protect one's market by effectively obtaining a limitation of consumer freedom.

Who are the members of the interministerial technical table

The five external members of the Commission appointed by the Minister of Health - reports the sheet - are Antonio Gasbarrini (Catholic University - Gemelli), Claudio Franceschi (University of Bologna), Alberto Villani (Bambino Ges√π), Alessandro Cocconcelli (Catholic University) and Andrea Fabbri (Tor Vergata University). All five are part of the Think Tank of Aletheia, the foundation created and promoted by Coldiretti, with whom he also shares the headquarters. A conflict of macroscopic interests that is also found in a document produced by the "clinical component" of the work table, a text in which you enter the merits of the EFSA guidelines and ask for, without mentioning arguments or sources, the one that asks for the association of farmers, that is, that "to be able to evaluate the food safety of the cultivated meat cd, clinical and pre-clinical tests are necessary".

Of the widow (+Europe): "A short -sighted and meaningless battle"

The anomaly of a ministerial organ in fact monopolized on the one hand was noticed by the deputy of +Europe, Benedetto della widow, who filed a parliamentary question to ask Schillaci and lollobrigid ministers according to which criteria the appointments were decided. Of the widow, together with Riccardo Magi and other exponents of his party, had literally been attacked by a group of demonstrators of Coldiretti with their president, Ettore Prandini, during a peaceful sit-in against the approval of the law that prohibits the production of meat cultivated in Italy. "The conflict of interest - explains Benedetto Della widow to Wired - was admitted by the Aletheia Foundation itself, which presented itself to the EFSA as part of the case. In fact that document produced by the working table resembles a part of a partisan. The problem is that that body should represent all the parties and not only Coldiretti. The one against the flesh cultivated in the laboratory is a battle without any meaning, probably a suicide from an economic point of view because Outside Italy from a slice of the market, also removing the agro -industry of the important growth margins ".

Title: United States, with Trump traveling to America is a lot of the lot that can cost you the prison
Description:
United States customs are increasingly becoming a problem for European tourists. In recent months there has been an increase in episodes in which citizens of the Old Continent have been stopped, held in detention centers or sent back to the countries of origin during customs checks in the United States. The exceptional situation brought the German Foreign Ministry has modified its travel recommendations, warning that "false declarations on the reason for the stay or even a slight overcoming of the validity of the visa can lead to arrest, detention and expulsion". These events are influencing the choices of European travelers and the operators of the tourism sector, with economic repercussions for both the US market and for European airlines.

The cases documented by international newspapers

The stories of different European travelers, reported by the international media, have highlighted the severity of US borders controls and the hard conditions in detention centers for immigration. According to what reported by the German media cited by the Guardian, Jessica Br√∂sche, a 29 -year -old tattoo artist, was stopped for 46 days at the Ootay Mesa detention Center in San Diego, California, after trying to enter the United States from Mexico. Of these, 8 days would have spent them in isolation for reasons still not known. Also in California, on the border with Mexico, the 25 -year -old German Lucas Sielaff was also stopped for over two weeks, then repatriated, as he himself told to Spiegel.

Particularly paradoxical what happened to the 28 -year -old English Rebecca Burke, as reported by the New York Times: stop at the Canadian border, she was asked to go back to correct modules, but once returned to the USA she was handcuffed and retained for 21 days. The case, reported by the FP, of a French researcher who would have been denied the entrance after in his phone and PC would have been found criticism of Trump's policy towards the academic world, was also particularly critical. According to the Guardian reports, all these episodes would be a consequence of the invitation of the immigration controls wanted by the new Trump administration.

According to Tourism Economics, cited by the Corriere, international travel to the USA will fall by 5% this year, against an initial +9% expected, due to the policies and rhetoric of the Trump administration, with a loss of 64 billion dollars for the US tourism sector. The data of the American Department of Internal Security, analyzed by the Corriere, show that in the first two months of 2025 there was a drop in arrivals compared to the same period of 2024: -9.5% from Italy, -6% from France, -7% from Germany.

Limited rights for tourists at borders with the United States

As the New York Times explains, despite having a visa or electronic authorization (ESTA), entry into the United States is not guaranteed in any case. In fact, once you arrive at the border, visitors must demonstrate that they want to use the visa for the declared purpose, answering the questions of the officers on motif and duration of the trip, accommodation and expected activities. Also the New York Times, citing the American Civil Liberties Union, underlines that the federal law gives ample power to the agents at the border, which can search for travelers' assets, including telephones and computers, without the need to suspect an offense. Those who enter Esta also renounces many rights, including that of contesting deportation, which exposes them to mandatory detention.

The New York newspaper explains that if a visitor is judged not admissible, he can withdraw his intention of entering the US and returning to his country, with the erased visa. But if the officer denies the withdrawal, detention starts. And since technically these situations take place outside the US territory, the rights guaranteed by the American Constitution do not apply and there is not necessarily right to a lawyer. The government is about 90 days for deportation, which can be extended in case of non -collaboration. After the expulsion order, the prohibition of entry to the USA for 5 years is triggered.

Title: Accessories for drones, on Temu those to create war machines cost very little
Description:
Commercial drones have been popular for about fifteen years, and now proliferate in every sector as well as among fans. You are likely to have an acquaintance, perhaps a neighbor, who owns one. For this reason, when the researchers of the security company for Embedded Red Balloon devices began to see unusual accessories for Quadrirotori on Chinese ecommerce platforms such as Temu and Aliexpress, initially they have not given much weight to the thing. As with any type of very widespread gadgets, even for drones there is a whole ecosystem of niche and extravagant accessories. But reflecting well, the CEO of Red Balloon Ang which and his colleagues realized how cheap and easy for anyone to buy additional components that could easily transform a traditional drone into a war machine.

Among the accessories found by the researchers there are fiber optic cables long kilometers and the so -called "driving modules for drones" (at the drone Guidance modles), essentially small cameras mounted on the aircraft that use the ability to recognize objects to identify humans and long distance road vehicles. The former work a bit like an Ethernet cable connected to a notebook and allow drones to fly in a large area without being vulnerable to the interference of the systems that disturb the signals. The researchers had already seen these tools in the films shot in the conflict areas and in other news that took into account their use by both factions involved in the war between Russia and Ukraine, to release explosives or crash drones against objectives without the need for operator control.

Living a drone to a few euros

The fact that this war technology is widely available all over the world at low cost brings out a scenario in which any actor - from criminal organizations to paramilitary groups, passing through discontented employees and teenagers isolated from society - can quickly and with an expense contained the necessary equipment to launch violent attacks and sow distance destruction.

"The more we looked at this situation and we started to see the general picture, the more my heart sinked, because these are very effective to kill people - he says to which Wired Us -. This technology did not exist in the commercial field two years ago, it was not required by the hobbyists, but now the producers are building it for the war and it is spreading".

Title: The facial recognition of the fans in San Siro still leaves many doubts
Description:
Being able to associate a face with the name on the football match ticket thanks to the facial recognition technologies teased the fantasies of the Serie A League for a long time, as well as the Minister of the Interior Planning who has often spoken of the possible introduction of biometric technologies to counter insecurity in the stadiums. They were only words until 2016, the year in which at the Olympic Stadium in Rome the company Sport and Health, which manages the sports facility and is participated by the MEF, the Ministry of Economy, bought a facial recognition system from the note Reco 3.26. This is the company that equipped the police forces of the Sari system the following year, in 2017. In 2017. Using it during the games to frame fans that launch firecrackers or smoke bombs (or that have other incorrect behavior) is Digos, which inside has a section dedicated to fans and sports events, and which compares the videos taken within the stadium with the images resumed to the entrance gates. The Privacy Privacy Guarantor had turned on green light for this use.

Facial recognition and Daspo

A new system, however, heads at the Olimpico in 2021. As reconstructed by an investigation by Irpimedia, Sport and Health Spa has decided to go beyond making a new purchase: a system, always provided by Reco 3.26, which would allow the monitoring of subjects subjected to Daspo (a restrictive order for the attendance of sporting events, ed.). In the classroom, the Minister planted has in fact confirmed in part what was written in the investigation, stating that in the Roman stadium there is a system "with a function of acquiring the biometric data of the spectators" which allows "the acquisition of the images of the spectators automatically combined with the name of the person, as it results from the control of access to the turnstiles and the ticket office in the event of certain offenses committed within the stadium. I remember the measure. Daspo and the deferred arrest ".

In the documents of the Olympic contract, however, we read clearly that the cameras would be used to "previously identify the subjects subjected to Daspo", and therefore it is implicitly declared that this can take place by analyzing the faces at the entrance in real time to make a selection between those who can and cannot enter. All this before the game starts and that therefore any clashes have occurred. For this new system of 2021, contrary to what was requested by the moratorium in force, no request for evaluation had arrived at the desk of the Privacy Guarantor. Four years later the ministry made a copy and paste. During the parliamentary question of March 20 to clarify the new experimentation of facial recognition in the stadiums, this time in San Siro, the senator Pd Filippo Sensi declared: "[...] print articles tell us that to authorize this train fishing, of rights, lives, democracy it would have been a positive opinion of the privacy guarantor. But it is a lie, minister, I never say, I never say, This concentrationary idea of ‚Äã‚Äãbeing together ‚Äù.

Doubts about cameras at Meazza

According to what reported by Repubblica on 17 March, in fact, to the gates reserved for the curves and guests of the Milan and Inter stadium, facial recognition cameras would have been installed. "The goal of the Serie A League is to extend the project to all the stages of the championship in the next two years" reports the newspaper. At the question time planted, he declared in the classroom that the focus on video surveillance is "among the measures identified as effective to prevent the multiplication of episodes of violence and make the sports facilities a safe place". The minister also declares that at the Meazza "it is not a facial recognition in real time, but only the possibility of tracing exactly to the identity of a person who has made an offense within the stadium after the commission of the same, precisely in order to allow the application of those prevention and contrast measures I have mentioned (Daspo and deferred arrest, ed.)".

The Minister also confirms the concerns of senses and the minority, declaring that "interlocutions are underway with the privacy guarantor for the improvement of the information aimed at users". Interlocutions that would however have to take place on the system (and not only for information) even before the system tests at the stadium. According to the words of plating then, the experimentation at San Siro will end "at the end of this month and consequently the system does not yet be operational". In short, from the exchange to the Senate some additional information emerged on the Reco 3.26 system to Meazza but once again the responses received have highlighted an inaccurate management of biometric technologies by the Ministry of the Interior, which not only does not guarantee adequate transparency on the latter but does not correctly follow even the process provided for by the moratorium in force.

Title: North Korea has created a hacker unit dedicated to artificial intelligence
Description:
North Korea strengthens its commitment to hacking projects aimed at the western world. The news comes from Daily NK, headed based in Seoul that last week revealed the decision of the North Korean leader Kim Jong Uno to create the "Research Center 227" (Research Center 227), a new work unit operating within the Reconnaissance General Bureau (RGB), dedicated to the research and development of "Hacking offensive hacking technologies and programs" - according to a source close to regime. In this way, the North Korean authorities hope to strengthen the ability of hackers to neutralize the computer security systems of western countries, so as to increase the number of attacks aimed at the theft of information and digital goods, and the interruption of the affected IT networks.

According to reports from Daily NK, which reported what revealed by a source close to Kim Jon Una, the research center will be located in the Mangyongdae district - not too far from the capital Pyongyang - and will focus on a series of very specific activities: the search for techniques to neutralize the safety networks, the development of theft technologies of information based on artificial intelligence, hacking of financial assets, and the creation of automated programs for the collection and analysis of the information subtracted from the affected networks. In addition, to make the new unit even more functional, the authorities imagine making the operating center 24 hours a day, so that they can develop the information from the North Korean hackers in real time outside national borders.

A decidedly impressive project, for which the RGB is already selecting the staff to be included in the research center 227, with the intention of initially recruiting a ninety of computer experts who have graduated with excellent votes. "The selected staff is made up of talented people who have specialized in the development of programs, automation or computer security systems at local universities, doctoral programs or university research institutes - said a source close to the Daily NK regime - these are not IT criminals that directly carry out computer security missions abroad, but of internal research personnel who develop offensive programs".

Title: What was talked about at Wired Health 2025
Description:
The way in which medical information can be shared is one of the points touched by Bart de Witte, one of the greatest European experts and a visionary in the digital transformation of health. He is co-founder of Isaree, a pioneering company that is developing an operating system for the medical and agents to, which he defines the "spatify of medical intelligence": "We are looking at the IA in the wrong way, that is, only as a software, instead we must think of it as a way to 'compress' medical knowledge. This allows to decrease the times of innovation in this field and save the lives." Looking at the theme of the staff, according to De Witte, in the near future it will not be strange to think that doctors and nurses can have a virtual assistant who will help them in their daily work. Carlo Tacchetti, of the Vita Salute San Raffaele University, specifies the importance, within the framework of regulations, to have a specific approach for Healthcare, which must take into account "patients' privacy, safety and reliability" to create relevant models that can use replicable procedures.

In the Health area, synthetic data cannot be ignored today, that is, those artificially generated that replicate the characteristics of the real ones, which have various challenges in front of them, including that of not compromising privacy. Giulia Conti Head of Innovation, Business Excellence and Mature Portfolio of Novartis Italia, specifies: "The application of technology in a health system allows immediate saving between 5 and 10%. Our working tables in progress show that technology and data can bring value without changing the quality of care of patients. Furthermore, the interoperability of the disciplines is fundamental". "We are doing well in the European Union to keep the point on the defense of fundamental rights or is there something we can correct? - Luca Bolognini Cassationist lawyer and President Italian Institute for Privacy Founding Partner, ICTLC, wonders - We have concentrated so far on data protection, an example is the GDPR. The European legislator has now realized a sub -trial, because in the meantime the world has changed, technologies that allow a balance between protection and other interests ". Davide Ruffo di Aindo highlights the potential of the synthetic data "its statistical importance and clinical relevance" which can "offer an acceleration of production of clinical evidence and the discovery of new combinations and therapeutic borders".

At the service of a safer and efficient healthcare, algorithms can play an important role. There are already virtual assistants today that are supporting the staff: "In the Veneto Region on access and the case management of the services, the operators have virtual assistants who help them during and after the calls of patients. If a citizen calls an emergency number and is addressed to a emergency room, there is a virtual assistant who controls if he actually has made access and in the negative he calls him to control" Gianmario Cinelli says, a teacher Healthcare Management at Bocconi and founder of Vermed-Ai. For Alice Borghini of Agenas, a crucial node in the use of generative AI within the NHS will be "the understanding of this technology, the explanation of the various actors, to use it consciously".

Title: Schwa and asterisks in official communications, the Ministry of Education invites the stop with a circular
Description:
Schwa returns to discure. The Ministry of Education and merit has sent a circular to Italian schools with which "invites to maintain the use of correct and accessible language, in compliance with current linguistic rules". In practice, an invitation not to use asterisk and Schwa in official communications, which also include the texts of the websites of the institutes. The measure is based on the opinion of the Accademia della Crusca, which highlighted how these graphic signs can hinder the clarity and uniformity of the institutional texts.

No Schwa in official communications

The Ministry of Education has made it known that it has received, in recent months, several reports regarding the use of the astterns (*) and the Schwa (…ô) - used to indicate the neutral genre - in documents and school communications. These symbols raised a debate on their compatibility with the rules of the Italian language.

Following the reports, Minister Giuseppe Valditara decided to intervene with an official circular intended for all educational institutions. The document reads that "the use of non -compliant graphic signs, such as asterisk (*) and Schwa (…ô), is in contrast with linguistic rules and risks compromising the clarity and uniformity of institutional communication". The Ministry also underlines the importance of maintaining accessible and consistent terminology in official texts.

The Accademia della Crusca, repeatedly asked on the topic, reiterated that the use of these graphic signs in institutional documents is not grammatically correct and can compromise the readability and accessibility of the texts. "The arbitrary use of these symbols introduces elements of ambiguity and dysomogeneity, making communication less understandable and less effective", we still read in the circular. The debate is on, but the use of these symbols is not frequent in institutional communications of schools.

Title: What are the cheapest VPNs and how to choose them based on the price
Description:
In recent months, the interest in VPN services has grown enormously. To tow the success of the Virtual Private Network are two factors: the growing attention to security and fears for privacy linked to a digital ecosystem in which the interest in user data is leading to increasingly invasive tracking techniques.

But how much does a good VPN service cost? The market in this sector has evolved quickly and has rather particular characteristics. Here's how to orient yourself in the choice, what errors to avoid and what are the strategies to save a few euros.

Security is paid

When it comes to security software, it is essential to remember that the economic aspect must not be considered prevalent: the main objective is (and must remain) to have a really effective service. The speech is valid for free VPNs, but it remains valid also for low -cost ones.

Those who choose to use a protected connection need a reliable service, which guarantees good performance and stability of the connection in any situation. All characteristics that require an adequate infrastructure, constant maintenance of the systems and the offer of an assistance service that allows you to promptly solve any problem. Letting yourself be enticed by offers at bargain prices, consequently, is a bad idea.

The risk is to be with a service with swinging or, worse still, with a VPN that is not constantly updated to face any bugs or vulnerabilities that would end up putting the safety of the connection at risk. When we use a VPN, in fact, we convene all our traffic on a single platform. If we choose the wrong solution, we run the risk of obtaining the opposite effect to the desired one.

How free VPN tests work

If you exclude some isolated cases, VPN service providers do not explicitly offer free tests, but use a slightly different policy that allows you to achieve the same goal. In most cases, in fact, they adopt a "satisfied or refunded" logic. The scheme, therefore, is what requires the activation (and payment) of the subscription but allows you to terminate the contract within a certain period of time.

Of course, as in all these cases it is essential to have the foresight to set up a reminder to remember the exact expiry of the offer. The risk, in fact, is to be linked to a contract (perhaps rather expensive) due to a simple forgetfulness.

To extricate yourself between special offers

Unfortunately, also in the VPN sector marketing is the master and getting a clear idea of ‚Äã‚Äãprices is quite difficult. Finding a commercial operator who clearly speaks in advertising is extremely difficult and the demonstration also comes from the fact that almost all providers do not disdain attracting new customers through not exactly clean tricks. Many sites dedicated to VPN services, for example, display a notice that shows the IP address of those who visit the page indicating that it has an "unprotected" connection. Too bad that this appears even if you visit it by using a VPN.

Title: Apple must "open" other functions of its operating system in Europe
Description:
The EU has clear ideas on the way Apple must improve the interoperability of iOS in Europe, making some of its functions available also to smartwatches, headphones and third -party speakers. Precisely for this reason, Tuesday the European Commission "approved two decisions pursuant to the Digital Markets Act (DMA) that specify the measures that Apple must take to comply with some aspects of its interoperability obligation". More specifically, these are two series of very different measures: the first, specifically aimed at iPhone and iPad users, concerns nine iOS connectivity functions, which Apple must make available for use by other devices. In this way, the devices of manufacturers other than Apple will work better when connected to an iPhone.

The measures promulgated by the European Commission, in fact, will guarantee both devices manufacturers and app developers "a better access to the iPhone functions that interact with these devices (for example, the display of notifications on smartwatches), faster data transfers (peer-to-peer wi-fi connections and Near-Field communication) and a simpler configuration of devices (such as coupling). Specifically, one of the salient points of this set of measures is the extension of access to iOS notifications, which allows its viewing and interaction also from third -party smartwatch, like what happens exclusively with the Apple Watch. And it doesn't end here. Even functions such as shareplay or options that allow Apple earphones to switch from one device to another should be made available on third -party devices, so as to avoid users to have to buy AirPods to take advantage of certain functionality.

In addition, this would mean that other platforms will also be able to send and receive data via Airdrop and Airplay when they are connected to an Apple device. In short, an all -intendedness in all respects for European users. The second series of measures, on the other hand, aims to improve the transparency and effectiveness of the process conceived by Apple for developers who want to obtain interoperability with the functions of iPhone and iPad. This will translate, among other things, in a faster management of interoperability requests, effectively allowing consumers to have a wider choice of devices and services capable of interacting with iPhone and iPad. Overall, therefore, Apple will have to review his position in Europe, seeing himself forced to share a lot of his features with other producers.

Title: The speculation on the coin meme does not even stop in front of the tragedies
Description:
This article contains references to suicide. If you or someone you know needs help, you can contact Telefono Amico at 02 2327 2327 or the other numbers reported at the end of the text.

The twenty -three year old Arnold Robert Haro turned his last words on the phone he had in his hand. "If I die, I hope you transform all this into a meme coin," he said, before killing himself.

Haro died on February 21 in the family home in the county of Madera, California, as shown by a death certificate obtained by Wired Us. He sent his suicide live to his followers on X, where he called himself @mistafuccyou. Even if the movie was then removed, the episode ended briefly among the trends reported by the platform.

Unscrupulous trader

In the hours following Haro's death, dozens of meme coin have been created with his name, as highly volatile cryptocurrency is defined as mainly used as a financial speculation tool. By warning the opportunity to earn, the traders have spilled above all on one of these digital coins, making them rise to 2.1 million dollars in total (since then the cryptocurrency has lost 96% of its value).

On x some there are those who claimed that anyone behind the meme coin Mistafuccyou had made Haro's last desire. But most users condemned the trader's attempt to try to profit from his death. "If you are trading with this coin, you're sick," a person wrote.

Voices spread on the social network according to which Haro would have killed himself because he had lost money due to a "rugpull", the maneuver in which someone creates a new coin, promotes it online and then sells their shares all at once, devaluing those of other users. Wired has not been able to confirm whether this is actually what happened in Haro, but his friends contest the reconstruction. "It has nothing to do with cryptocurrencies [...] is not what all these nerds of cryptocurrencies seem to think," one of Haro's friends told Wired, who on social media calls himself J Nova. In the meantime, the man of man described his death as a consequence of "his battle against depression".

Title: The case of the teacher of Treviso on Onlyfans pushes the Ministry of Education to review the rules on social media
Description:
A teacher on Onlyfans is a more unique than rare case. It happened in the Treviso area. The woman, who teaches in a kindergarten was suspended because it is enrolled in the platform that allows you to publish explicit content in exchange for money. Some parents of pupils, after finding his images on the net, reported him to the institute where he worked (of Catholic matrix), accusing it of non -ethical conduct. The school college has now decided to suspend it from teaching and paying the salary.

The story of the teacher on Onlyfans

The suspended teacher is Elena Maraga, a 29 -year -old body building athlete. The young woman had a public profile on Instagram connected to a second private account in which she published the links to access her Onlyfans content.

The story divided the families of his students: in fact, if some have publicly and very critically told the story, others took the defenses of the teacher by signing a letter in his support. Meanwhile, Maraga has been temporarily suspended from teaching without salary.

According to the school, in fact, his activity on social adults would be "incompatible" with the religious imprint of the structure and would be reflected on a potential dismissal. However, the 29 -year -old said he repeatedly not to be willing to take steps back on his source of online income. Also because, he said the gain on the platform a lot exceeds the teacher's revenues. As the Corriere della Sera reports: "I have opened Onlyfans for a while more than a month but I have already seen that the timetable is not comparable with that of the school". "The work I do is now economically unsustainable: with 1,200 euros a young woman who lives alone like me cannot do anything". Now the ball passes to their lawyers.

To an ethical code for professors on social media

After the relative news of the case, the Minister of Education and merit, Giuseppe Valditara, communicated that he had created a commission of jurists in order to update the code of conduct of public employees. The regulation had already been modified in July 2023, with the introduction of some specific rules governing the behaviors on social networks of all public employees, including school staff, for which a specific part dedicated to them would also be in progress.

Title: Rakuten Securities urgently warns -- "Installing additional certifications immediately and trying to preserve assets."
Description:
On the night of March 21st, Rakuten Securities issued an urgent warning to users. They are calling for immediate setup of an additional login authentication service (two-factor authentication) to preserve their own assets.

The login additional authentication service can be set from Rakuten Securities' "My Menu>Security Settings>Add Login Additional Authentication."

According to Rakuten Securities, phishing scams that pretend to be Rakuten Securities have caused the stolen login IDs, passwords, and transaction PINs to be plagiarized.

Setting up an additional login authentication service reduces the risk of authentication information such as IDs and passwords being stolen even if a phishing site exists. Additionally, although trading PINs may be required when ordering stocks or making various changes, they are not required immediately after entering your login ID and password.

Furthermore, the company also warns that "the number of victims of fraudulent transactions via emails pretending to be Rakuten Securities is rapidly increasing."

Regarding Rakuten Securities, damage has spread on X (formerly Twitter) and other media, with the effect that "the securities held were sold without permission and Chinese stocks were being bought out unfamiliar."

Title: The problem of lacking real-world data training AI, the solution to "synthetic data" - has NVIDIA acquired?
Description:
Wired, a US giant, has acquired synthetic data Gretel for more than about $320 million, reported. An NVIDIA spokesperson declined to comment on the matter.

Generators of AI development are becoming more difficult to gather enough data to train models and improve performance, and there is a growing need for data to "create" data.

According to reports, Gretel employees will join Nvidia. Gretel, which provides synthetic (simulation) data, appears to be playing a role in further enhancing Nvidia's services for AI developers.

Why synthetic data is important

Generating AI requires a huge amount of data, including large-scale language models such as OpenAI's ChatGPT. However, there are problems such as high noise and limited amounts of data in the real world.

AI companies are running out of free data and are facing the question of whether they are allowed to use copyrighted content without permission. Hundreds of actors, screenwriters and directors have also issued open letters to the Trump administration's Office of Science and Technology Policy, expressing concerns about the handling of copyright data.

Now OpenAI is asking the government to make copyrighted materials more widely available for training AI models, claiming that otherwise they could fall behind China.

That's where synthetic data comes in. This is a way to deal with the lack of data by artificially generating data that resembles the real world for AI learning.

Additionally, privacy concerns can be addressed. Even if information such as medical data is likely to identify an individual, the synthetic data provided by Gretel can eliminate privacy information and artificially produce statistically meaningful data. In other words, it can be used for AI learning without exposing actual data.

On the other hand, problems have been pointed out in the use of synthetic data. Relying too much on non-existent information increases the chances of your model increasing the incorrect output. It is said that in extreme cases, the model will collapse, and there is a risk that it will become too inaccurate to become practical.

Title: Passport "new application" online - Use MyNa Card, Low fees
Description:
On March 21, the government announced that it would also be possible to apply for "new issuance" passports online. All prefectures will be available from March 24th.

Previously, you could have applied for "renewal" passports online, but you had to go to the counter for new applications. All of these can only be completed online when applying, and you will need to go to the counter when you collect your passport.

Online applications can be made via MyNa Portal. To use this portal, you will need a My Number card, a smartphone that can read My Number cards, or a card reader.

With online applications, family register information is linked to the system, so there is no need to obtain a paper copy of the family register and submit it. Furthermore, information such as addresses and names is also automatically entered.

In addition, application fees will be reduced for online applications, and use will be expanded.

You can take a face photo for your passport using the camera function of the My Number Portal app. It is also possible to upload data saved to your device in advance.

Title: Salesforce builds an advantage with AI agents, and strategy development is being developed with AI executives
Description:
Salesforce will advance AI agents' strategies using "Agentforce," an AI agent foundation. CEO Marc Benioff is bullish, saying, "We aim to create 1 billion AI agents by 2025." The developer event held in San Francisco, USA from March 5th to 6th also set a new goal of becoming an "Agentblazer" for 1 billion people. We spoke to Adam Evans, Executive Vice President and General Manager of Salesforce AI, who spoke at the keynote speech at the event.



We spoke to Adam Evans, Executive Vice President and General Manager of AI at Salesforce. We spoke to Adam Evans, Executive Vice President and General Manager of AI at Salesforce.

--Agentforce 2dx was announced at the event. This is the second update, six months after the introduction of Agentforce. Please tell us what's behind the progress of this sudden pace.

There is a fundamental shift in technology. AI is comparable to the Internet, mobile and more, and we help our customers implement the latest AI technologies through Agentforce. That's why we are also speeding up the pitch of technological innovation.

--We have announced our goal to develop 1 billion AI agents through Agentforce by 2025. How about Progress? Also, which industry and business are the introduction of AI agents progressing?

Demand for Agentforce is strong and acceptance is also progressing. There were as many as 5,000 contracts in one quarter. It's progressing in all industries. So far, there has been a lot of customer service, but a wide range of AI agents have appeared in the long tail.

We thought that strictly regulated industries such as healthcare, which has high hurdles to implement AI, would be a challenge. We incorporate "Trust Layer," which has functions such as using data within appropriate guardrails (commonly known as functions that ensure proper use in line with security and compliance), and by using search extension generation (RAG), we achieve accurate and reliable solutions. Pfizer and CaixaBank (spanish banks) have already used Agentforce.

In the US, 1-800 Accountant, a leading accounting service for small and medium-sized businesses, has created an agent that automates the answers to tax questions for the busy season of the tax return, with a resolution rate of 50%. We also use it on the help page, and the resolution rate has reached 83%. In many cases, it quickly achieves a resolution rate of 30% and 40%, expanding the scope of application of AI agents.

Agentforce 2dx now works in the background, allowing you to make long inferences and build proactive agents with asynchronous nature.

--What kind of help Salesforce helps increase the resolution rate of AI agents to questions from customers and others?

There are various approaches to improving resolution rates. The important thing is to focus on "What problem are you trying to solve?"

At this event, we announced the new Agentforce feature, "Interaction Explorer." It is a function like observability that observes the implementation of Agentforce, allowing you to check whether it is functioning properly, what you are talking about in conversations with customers, and more. You can understand whether it is generating a return on investment (ROI) or whether it is generating value.

Another thing you can do to improve the resolution rate is to visualize the percentage of things you can't do. It helps you look at the long tail (in use cases) that AI agents can't handle and think about where to invest.

This falls into a business problem. You will decide how far you want Agentforce to go, where to deploy it, whether you should spend time on areas that cannot be resolved, and whether you should focus on building AI agents that optimize other parts.

Title: Tesla Cyber ‚Äã‚ÄãTruck recalls 8th time: Stainless steel exterior may fall off while driving
Description:
Tesla has recalled the CyberTruck electric pickup truck for the eighth time since its release.

According to a report submitted to US authorities, 46,096 units will be affected, with stainless steel exterior trim panels (decorative parts called "cant rails") falling off while driving, scattering them on the road, causing an accident. The panel is fixed with adhesive and fasteners, but it is said that the adhesive is prone to embrittlement due to environmental factors.

The recalls will be CyberTrucks manufactured between November 13th, 2023 and February 27th, 2024, and Tesla will replace the relevant parts for free. Vehicle owners will be sent a recall notification by mail, and are urging them to contact Tesla's customer service if they have any questions.

CyberTruck, which was released in 2023, only responded to around 70,000 units in its seventh recall in connection with the tire pressure monitoring system (TPMS) in December 2024.

It is said that in 2025 there was a time when Tesla began selling cybertrucks at its Texas factory, with production numbers being reduced. It also reported that some employees have been moved from the CyberTruck assembly line to the best-selling Model Y line.

Title: Marui starts "Museum EPOS Card" -- "You can support the museum" Visa Credit Card
Description:
On March 21st, Marui Group announced the Museum EPOS Card.

New issuances will be accepted from the same day as a new option for the company's EPOS Card credit card.

With the Museum EPOS Card, you can choose from 12 different tickets designed with cultural assets, specimens and materials held by the National Museum of Art, the National Institute of Cultural Properties, and the National Museum of Nature and Nature and Science.

A portion of the amount you spend on your card will be used for museum activities. In addition to donating 1,000 yen for each new membership to the three corporations with the ticket design they chose, 0.1% of the 0.5% points (1 point for every 200 yen) returned to users based on the amount they spend will be donated to users in place of the user.

Additionally, if users spend more than 30,000 yen (tax included) within three months of joining, they will receive a bonus based on the ticket design they have chosen. For example, many people visit the museum to look forward to seeing them, so each of the seven National Museums has prepared visual acrylic key chains chosen.

Mihashi Mayu, of Shinjuku Marui Group, who came up with the project this time, said, "Some of the points accumulated through everyday shopping will be donated and used in the management of each museum. Personally, I feel that this is an opportunity to give back to the things I receive from the museum as much as possible. I would like to create a system where people who also feel that they like museums can easily support each other."

Recently, the Marui Group has implemented various initiatives in its credit card "EPOS Card," which its company handles. The company is developing strategies that focus on "favorite activities", such as collaborations with "Tamagotchi", "FC Machida Zelvia", and "One Piece", as well as "EPOS Pet Cards", which allow you to create your own original designs.

Aida Shoichi, Managing Executive Officer of Marui Group, introduces a survey that shows that 68% are conscious of "conciliatory consumption" that separates what saves and what spends money on.

"As the Marui Group, we are currently focusing on an economy driven by 'love.' We tend to spend time on things we want to focus on, such as our hobbies and collections, which is the opposite of the 'cost-performance economy', which places importance on functions and prices. We want to aim for a new market imagination, driven by each individual's love," says Aida.

On the other hand, even if it is an EPOS card, if it is a higher-end card such as gold or platinum, the elements of each card, such as the design and perks, will disappear. Aida said, "We are aware that there is a need and are currently undergoing various considerations," adding some implications for future developments.

Title: Why did President Trump unsecret all the secrets of "Kennedy's assassination" -- how to view it from Japan
Description:
The Trump administration has all disclosed confidential files from the government investigation into the assassination of John F. Kennedy.

President Trump had pledged to release government records on several notable assassinations, rather early on after his return to the White House. And this week, new documents related to former President Kennedy's assassination will be made public faster than expected.

John F. Kennedy served as president from 1961 to 1963, and was shot multiple times from afar during a parade in Dallas on November 22, 1963, before being killed. The person arrested and charged as the perpetrator was Lee Harvey Oswald, a former Marine and a temporary exile in the Soviet Union.

Oswald claimed his innocence, but was shot dead before he was brought to trial. A later investigation by the Warren Commission concluded that Oswald committed the crime alone, but some people suspect that there was a conspiracy based on the background of the incident and Oswald's history.

The US Department of Justice has denied such conspiracy theories, but according to a 2023 Gallup survey, 65% of Americans still believe that the assassination has some sort of conspiracy involved.

And Trump ordered all unpublished government files regarding the Kennedy assassination to be made public. If you want to know more about where and how you can view these new information, please read on. It would also be a good idea to also keep an eye on recent trends regarding tariffs.

Why did Trump unsecret all the secrets?

Trump signed an executive order in January, dictating the "complete and complete release of materials relating to the assassination of President John F. Kennedy." While supporters welcomed this as a wise decision to increase government transparency, some critics say it is "creating a topic to divert attention from the major policy shifts that are currently underway across the federal government."

In fact, most of the government files related to the assassination of Kennedy have already been made public. With regard to the Warren Committee, approximately 98% of the total were published between 1994 and 1998, with an additional release in June 2023 reaching around 99%.

According to an ABC News report dated March 18, government officials have been preparing to release the documents since January, but the pace has suddenly accelerated this Monday. After Trump declared at a Kennedy Center event that "all new JFK-related files will be made public on Tuesday afternoon," the Department of Justice national security department mobilized to review the documents and attempted to meet the deadline for release.

‚óèWhere can you find the new material?

The files released this time can be viewed by anyone on the official National Archives website.

If you're interested, go to the "JFK Assassination Records - 2025 Documents Release" page and you'll find PDF documents.

As of Wednesday night, 2,182 documents had been added. It's a huge amount, and not all of the information is new, but if you read it carefully, it will take a reasonable amount of time. It is still a long way for experts and historians to finish examining all of the materials, but at this point there is a strong mood that "we should not expect any particularly large new facts."

"The reason it has not been published for so long is to protect the sources and means involved in US intelligence activities," New York Times reporter Adam Nagarney wrote in an article on March 18th.

‚óè Will files from other assassinations be released?

The executive order also includes the release of documents to investigate the assassination of Pastor King, who also led the civil rights movement, and Robert Kennedy, Kennedy's younger brother. Their assassination was also an incident in which various conspiracy theories have been whispered over the years.

Rev. King was a central figure in the civil rights movement, but was shot dead on April 4, 1968 while standing on the balcony on the second floor of the Lorraine Motel in Memphis, Tennessee. Officially, the perpetrator James Earl Ray, a fugitive, is believed to have been culprit, but Pastor King's family himself believes that "Mr. Ray was turned into a scapegoat," and conspiracy theories never faded.

Robert Kennedy also served as attorney general under his brother's administration, and later became a leading Democratic candidate in the 1968 presidential election. However, on June 5, 1968, shortly after winning the California primary, he was shot by Sarhan Beshala Sahan at the Ambassador Hotel in Los Angeles, and lost his life.

Title: Apple's latest earphones, "AirPods 4," is on sale on Amazon
Description:
Apple's latest earphones, the AirPods 4 series, is on sale on Amazon.

Compared to the direct sales price at the Apple Store, the top models equipped with Active Noise Cancelling (ANC) cost 4,000 yen cheaper at 25,717 yen. The lower models without ANC are 2,800 yen cheaper, at 19,000 yen. Compared to electronics retailers such as Yodobashi Camera, it is about 1,000 yen cheaper at the time of writing, and points redemption is equivalent.

Apple AirPods 4 (View sale prices on Amazon)



‚óèWhat is AirPods 4?

The AirPods 4 are open earphones that do not use earpieces. It is said to be smaller than the previous model and has improved fit to the ears.

In terms of sound quality, Apple's H2 chip has made the highs clearer and the bass is also enhanced, making it a clearer quality than the previous AirPods 3. Bluetooth connections also have increased stability and support lossless audio.

In addition, models equipped with ANC are rare for open earphones, and boast high noise canceling performance, making it possible to effectively suppress airplane engine sounds and low-frequency noise in the city. Although it does not provide the sound insulation of the same as the AirPods Pro 2, it is clearly superior to other companies' products that use the same open earphones to noise cancelling, and CNET reporters are surprised at their abilities.

The quality of voice calls is also excellent, reducing noise while still allowing clear voices to the other party. However, the battery life has not been improved and is slightly shorter than the previous model.

In conclusion, the basic model is for users looking for easy and excellent sound quality and performance, while the ANC model is an attractive option for those who want to cancel noise in a more affordable and practical way. Considering the price difference, the ANC model is rated as worth the extra cost.

Title: Huawei's wide folding smartphone "Pura X" has been released, with original OS and AI
Description:
Huawei has announced the new Pura X folding smartphone equipped with its own OS, the HarmonyOS 5.

The wide 6.3-inch display has an aspect ratio of 16:10, making it a rare feature for a flip smartphone. It is equipped with the new AI assistant "Xiaoyi", and will utilize not only Huawei's unique AI model, but also China's "DeepSeek" model. Prices in China start at 7,499 yuan (approximately 154,000 yen).

It has a 3.5-inch square display on the outside, and when opened, it will reveal a wide main screen. You can make calls and take photos even when folded. Accounts such as "Tech way" have already posted hands-on videos of this device on social media such as "Threads."

Although it has not been released globally yet, the regular edition and collector's edition are available in China. The Collector's Edition features different panel designs, green and red, with 16GB of RAM. The regular version of Pura X is available in three colors: black, white, and silver.

The company also announced another folding smartphone, the Mate X6, in December 2024.

Title: The need for "small smartphones" that iPhones have given up on, Google also ignores the Pixel 9a, in fact, is getting bigger
Description:
Google's Pixel 9a is a more affordable product, while fully embracing the good points of the company's Pixel 9 Pro. The Pixel a series, which has a very good balance between performance and price, has always been a good impression, but this time I feel like I missed a big opportunity in terms of "size."

Apple's recent release of the iPhone 16e effectively marked the end of the iPhone SE line, and the series was the last bastion of "really small smartphones."

The 2022 iPhone SE has a 4.7-inch screen size, and although there is some screen margin, it is more compact than the iPhone 16.

The iPhone 16e is said to be the successor to the SE, but it is 6.1 inches in size. I have been compiling a list of "small smartphones to buy" for years, but each model is increasingly becoming more and more difficult to continue writing articles.

Still, some people want small smartphones. It's difficult for your fingers to move as you would like, and it may be difficult to use on a large screen, or some people who love skinny jeans and think it's embarrassing to see a large device protruding. Some people may simply say they like small devices.

I chose the 6.3-inch iPhone 16 Pro, but I still find it difficult to handle because of its size. Regardless of the reason, there was always a certain demand for small smartphones, but now no one is aiming for them.

‚óèCritical standards for being considered "small"

Meanwhile, it is clear that Google is also indifferent to the needs of small smartphones, with the Pixel 9a also being 6.3 inches larger than the Pixel 8a's 6.1 inches.

Google probably conducted thorough market research and determined that a larger device was business-friendly. However, it would have been great if they released the Pixel 9a mini in parallel with the regular version, like the old smartphone makers. Apple and Samsung also launched several generations of "mini" models, as did manufacturers such as LG, Sony and HTC.

I have a desire to see the Pixel 9a mini appear on a 5.7-inch screen, but Google didn't. We have no choice but to gradually accept the changing standards of "small."
