In 2023, the American Agency for Advanced Defense Research Projects (DARPA) demonstrated the superiority of AI drivers over human pilots in air combat simulations.

In addition, its autonomous drones have obtained significant results on the Ukrainian battlefield, in particular by neutralizing Russian jamming and air defense networks.

Title: The National Assembly again revives against the creation of a P ...
Description:
After a technical breakdown around the statement of votes, the deputies of the National Assembly finally voted Thursday evening (119 against, 24 for) again against the creation of stolen doors in encrypted messaging such as WhatsApp or Signal.

The controversial provision, added to the bill against narcotrafic in the Senate, had already been deleted in the law committee. Before returning to debate in public session via a new amendment by deputy Olivier Marleix (republican right).

The latter proposed a rewriting of the provision supposed to calm the concerns, for example by subjecting the creation of these access to the advice of a commission chaired by the ANSSI, the French cyber firefighter. "This drafting without ambiguity prohibits any technical solution which would be based on the creation of a stolen door," said, without convincing, Olivier Marleix.

We do not have the result officially, but it is cooked: the amendments aimed at restoring the drafting of article 8 TER are rejected #directan #epplnarcotrafic - Arcadie project (@projectarcadie.com) March 2025 at 23:40

The interior not heard

"It will be a dialogue" with each platform, had abounded Bruno Retailleau, the Minister of the Interior, one of the rare supporters in the hemicycle. The deputies had castigated the creation of a "vulnerability", through the voice of Philippe Latombe (the Democrats) or a badly introduced debate by amendment, without in -depth reflection, like Anne Le H√©nanff (Horizons). "A sterile specifications", had finally pounded Eric Bothorel (set for the Republic).

A final group which had however left its freedom to vote to the deputies, for lack of consensus. While the national rally had conditioned its vote on support for its own sub-amendment, ultimately rejected.

The latter aimed at "crossing user connection data" with information provided by phones operating systems and operators.

Signal warning

On Wednesday, the president of the Signal Foundation reported on the social network X that the eponymous encrypted messaging would leave the French market rather than to comply with such a provision.

And to recall that such a legal interception would risk "undermining the solid confidentiality guarantees" of messaging.

Rejected by the National Assembly, the subject can however return to this bill. A final surprise could indeed intervene in the event of a joint joint committee meeting, this body responsible for finding an agreement between the two chambers on a law. Thus still to follow.

Title: Plaud Note test: the vocal recorder IA which is all the rage ...
Description:
Dictaphone Plaud Note, Ph. Jack Wallen/ZDNET.

Receive a selection of the latest software and hardware products for professionals every week in your mailbox with our newsletter purchasing guides. Learn more about the use of personal data

In the world of voice recording applications and devices, it's always the same thing: click or touch Save, start talking, stop and click Save.

Some voice recording applications allow basic transcriptions to be carried out (the Google Pixel recording application does impressive work in this regard), sharing notes, modifying the reading speed and offering other features (fairly basic).

But there is a new device that wants to demonstrate that vocal records can be much more than that. And this is the Plaud Note.

The three essential points to remember from the dictaphone Plaud Note

Plaud Note is on sale at a price of ‚Ç¨ 170.

This device and application combo shows your notes take to a new level of efficiency.

The Plaud Note device requires a paying subscription to benefit from artificial intelligence functions.

You have probably never heard of Plaud. But the company has created the best dictaphone on the market.

Plaud Note is a thin device (almost the size of a credit card) which allows you to save voice messages by clicking on a button. Once the recording is completed, the file is automatically synchronized with the mobile application (Android, iOS) where a real magic occurs! Plaud Note is not content to transcribe text recording, but also uses artificial intelligence to summarize it.

My experience with the Dictaphone Plaud Note

When I received the Plaud apparatus noted for the first time, I said to myself: "Why would someone need this device when he has a perfectly effective voice recorder on his phone?" And as everyone has a phone, everyone has a voice recorder.

The Plaud Note remained on my desk for about a week, begging me to discover all its capacities. But I abstained because this first opinion had convinced me that it was a device that did not deserve to be tested.

Then I capitulated and tried this plaud note.

The technical characteristics of the Plaud Note dictaphone

Transcription capacities and summary AI developed on GPT-4O and Claude 3.5 Sonnet.

Recording in a single pressure for meetings and calls.

112 Transcription languages ‚Äã‚Äãsupported.

Several professional models adapted to multiple scenarios.

30 hours of continuous recording on a single load, 60 days in standby.

Internal storage of 64 GB.

UltraSimple Interface

It took about five minutes for me to be absolutely convinced by this small device. I recorded notes and I summarized them with shared transcriptions and usable as quickly as a standard voice recording application can perform these basic tasks.

The transcription and summary of vocal records are so simple with Plaud Note. Screenshot by Jack Wallen/ZDNET

In other words, Plaud Note very quickly proved me its usefulness.

To record a note and summarize it:

Make sure the cursor is in a low position

Press the only button on the device and hold it down until Plaud vibrates. You can then start saving

Once the recording is finished, press the button again and hold it down until it vibrates

Plaud note will then automatically synchronize the new recording with the application

Select the new synchronized note, then press the summary button

You will then be invited to select a summary model and Plaud Note will then work

Effective transcription and summary

I recorded several notes, I made them transcribe. And I found that the transcription on the application was as precise as that of the recording application on Android. Which means that it is impressive.

I even created mental cards from different recordings and I could see how useful this device/application combo could be for many types of users.

Plaud Note is as easy to use as any vocal registration appliance or application. But his features really distinguishes him from competition.

Also designed to record phone calls

Plaud notes to another asset in its sleeve, but it must be used with caution. This function allows calls to be saved.

Pass the button from the low position to the high position

Slide the aircraft in its Magsafe case

Slide the case on your phone (with a Magsafe case), and Plaud will record your call.

However, make sure to know if you are allowed to record a call before you start. I cannot insist too much on this point.

During the week I used Plaud Note, I wanted to record more vocal notes in order to be able to transcribe and summarize them. As an author, I found this function useful because I can record a note on a book, ask Plaud notes to transcribe and summarize my description, then save it in a Google document for subsequent use. And like this Plaud Note dictaphone is very small, I can take it everywhere with me.

Purchase advice for dictaphone Plaud Note

Here is the problem, and you guessed it. The Plaud Note device is offered at a reasonable price of ‚Ç¨ 170. But Plaud's AI part (for transcriptions, summaries, mental cards, etc.) requires a paying subscription. The options can be viewed on the subscription page to Plaud AI. The formulas range from a transcription quota of 600 minutes for 10 ‚Ç¨ to the unlimited formula, which costs 250 ‚Ç¨ per year. There are other formulas:

Plaud AI annual subscription (1,200 minutes/month) at ‚Ç¨ 90.

Plaud AI transcription quota (6,000 minutes) at ‚Ç¨ 100.

Plaud AI transcription quota (3,000 minutes) at ‚Ç¨ 60.

Without subscription, Plaud will continue to record and synchronize notes in your application. But without AI, there will be no transcriptions or summaries. However, you can buy a 600 -minute transcription quota, use it and buy another if necessary.

The Plaud Note solution is well worth its price. If you are a busy person, on the move, and you need a better way to save voice notes, Plaud is an excellent option.

Title: ZD Tech: Lip-Bu tan, the man who must resuscitate Intel
Description:
It was one of the surprises of the end of last year. Pat Gelsinger, the Boss of the Intel Founder, was put on the sidelines by the shareholders of the company.



All tech news for pros every day in our newsletter learn more about the use of personal data

And until then, no one knew who was going to take its place. And here is the semiconductor giant last week appointed Lip-Bu Tan, 65, as general manager.

Let us look at man, and his strategy to redo the Intel machine.

So who is Lip-Bu tan?

He is a veteran of the semiconductor industry, with more than two decades of experience.

It is known for growth under its management of income and the margin of the CAPE DESIGN SYSTEMS software company. But he is also the founder of a venture capital company. Its expertise is therefore based on the software, and the investment. In short, he is not a specialist in processors and computer infrastructure.

Nevertheless, the man offers a strategic break with the previous management.

Change of strategic course for Intel

Under the direction of Pat Gelsinger, Intel had developed a strategy of expanding its manufacturing capacities. The idea was to compete with giants like Taiwanese TSMC by producing fleas for third parties.

However, this approach has encountered obstacles, especially due to delays in manufacturing technology. The consequence was a loss of market share for the benefit of competitors like Nvidia. And therefore the eviction of Pat Gelsinger.

LIP-BU TAN adopts a different approach to it. He plans to refocus Intel on product innovation and engineering, emphasizing the development of advanced products. In addition, it assesses the possibility of separating the divisions from the design and manufacturing of fleas. And this would mark a significant change in relation to the traditional vertical integration of Intel.

Lip-BU tan well received, for the moment

It is therefore a risky bet. But for the moment, the market reacts pretty well.

The announcement of the appointment of LIP-BU Tan was well received, with a 15 % increase in Intel action.

Above all, analysts are optimistic about its ability to straighten the business.

Title: Scaling human connections--Qualtrics announces AI agent "Experience Agent"
Description:
Qualtrics held its annual event, Qualtrics X4 2025: The Experience Management Summit, in its home base in Salt Lake City, Utah, from March 18th to 20th. CEO Zig Serafin took the stage at the main keynote speech on the 19th, and presented AI agents such as "Experience Agent." The company's strategy for several years, "human connections built through experiences," remains the same even for AI agents.



Zig Serafin, CEO of Qualtrics Zig Serafin, CEO of Qualtrics

Non-transactional agents specializing in human connections

Qualtrics was founded in 2002, mainly by parents and children who were researching the market. Growing as a research tool for schools and businesses to gather feedback from students and customers. Now, as "eXperience Management" (XM), which demonstrates the management of people's experiences, we operate employees (XM for Employee Experience), customers (XM for Customer), and strategy and research (XM for Strategy and Research) based on the XM platform.

Serafin, who joined the company in 2016 and headed the company as CEO since 2020, explained the importance of "connection" in front of the 6,000 customers and partners gathered at the venue.

Organizations invest heavily in building customer relationship management (CRM), chatbots, workflow management, and more. "These are aimed at optimization and automation, and are just "fast," "cheap" and "efficient." Serafin warns.

"The race is beginning to implement AI and improve efficiency, but we need to make sure we don't lose sight of the bigger picture," says Serafin. So, what will happen if we don't place importance on connection?

For example, if a mobile phone company cannot recognize a customer who has been using it for years for monthly fees and is unable to provide services at the right time (if the customer experience is poor), the customer will easily switch to another mobile phone company.

Serafin reveals that he decided to change his mobile phone company because of his own experience, but says, "If the mobile phone company can fix the problem before a customer has had a problem and calls the customer center, if they can realize there is a problem and propose support, or if they sense that they are thinking of switching and take measures such as distributing coupons, the customer won't be forced to wait long or get frustrated, and if they can get a positive customer experience, they won't be able to switch if they can propose their needs ahead of time."

The ideal is for people to be present and supportive, but it is not realistic. However, technology is becoming more and more accessible to maintain connections in an expandable way. These are XM and the newly announced Experience Agent.

As previously reported, Experience Agent is "a specialized, autonomous digital worker, like an employee expansion," says Serafin, who explains that it is "intelligent and has the ability to make decisions and action to suit the many experiences that occur in the company."



"Experience Agent" for AI Agent "Experience Agent" for AI Agent

AI agents are the "buzzword" that every vendor talks about, but Serafin points out that AI agents provided by many other vendors are "transactional, focused on processing and transactions." Meanwhile, Qualtrics' Experience Agent explained the difference as "it is rooted in our unique ability to understand people."

An example is a survey of customer experiences. When a customer fills out a problem, the Experience Agent will start during the investigation to resolve the customer's problem. Say you can deal with the matter immediately without waiting for the investigation to be completed. Another example is that when Experience Agent sees customer feedback from various customer contact points and finds that it is dissatisfied with one service, it is possible to predict that other customers will also experience the same dissatisfaction, providing personalized services ahead of time.

Title: DeepSeek's AI has been accelerated by 30 times -- announced at "NVIDIA GTC"
Description:
In January 2025, the introduction of the large-scale language model (LLM) DeepSeek-R1 led to a sharp drop in the stock market. Seven weeks later, NVIDIA, a chip giant leading the way in AI processing, is trying to put its company at the heart of DeepSeek's inexpensive AI economy.

On March 18th, NVIDIA co-founder and CEO Jensen Huang spoke about how the company's Blackwell GPU significantly improves the inference performance of the DeepSeek-R1 at the NVIDIA GTC 2025 (March 16-21), an annual developer event for developers held at the SAP Center in San Jose, California.

With the recently announced open source inference software "NVIDIA Dynamo," Blackwell claims that DeepSeek-R1 has about 30 times the processing power of a regular data center. This is measured in the number of tokens per second.

"Dynamo takes advantage of its advantages and offers over 30 times more performance for inference models, including DeepSeek, with the same number of GPUs and the same architecture," Ian Buck, head of hyperscale and high-performance computing at NVIDIA, said at a pre-opened press conference.

Dynamo, available on GitHub from March 18th, will distribute inference work across up to 1,000 NVIDIA GPU chips. By dispersing and processing the tasks in parallel, it becomes possible to increase the amount of work that can be achieved per second.

As a result, in inference tasks where $1 per million tokens are charged will increase the number of tokens that can be performed per second, and sales per second for services that provide GPUs will increase.

"Service providers can choose to either run queries from more customers on DeepSeek, or allocate more processing power to a particular customer and charge an additional fee as a premium service," Buck said.

Premium Service

Buck said, "AI Factory can provide higher quality services at a premium rate per million tokens," and continued, "and can also increase the total token amount across the factory." AI Factory is a coined term for NVIDIA and refers to a large-scale service that performs large amounts of AI work using chips, software and rack-based equipment.



NVIDIA DGX Spark and NVIDIA DGX Station (provided by NVIDIA) NVIDIA DGX Spark and NVIDIA DGX Station (provided by NVIDIA)

NVIDIA's outlook that "using more chips will increase AI inference throughput and, in turn, grows business" is an answer to investors' concerns that "DeepSeek will reduce the amount of processing required for each query, which will reduce overall computer processing power usage."

Buck said that using Dynamo and Blackwell together will allow AI data centers to generate approximately 50 times more sales than they would if they used the previous model, the Hopper.

NVIDIA shared its own improvements to DeepSeek-R1 with HuggingFace. In the NVIDIA version, the number of bits used by R1 to manipulate variables is reduced to "FP4" (4 floating point bits). This is only a small portion of the computational amount required for "B-float 16" (standard floating point 32 bits).

"Blackwell's performance has been significantly improved over Hopper," Buck said. "It was achieved without any major changes, reductions or losses to the accuracy model. It remains a model that generates high-quality inference tokens."

Huang also announced Blackwell's latest edition, the Blackwell Ultra. Ultra has enhanced various aspects, such as increasing DRAM (Dynamic Random Access Memory) from 192GB wideband memory, the HBM3E, to a maximum of 288GB.

When combined with the CPU "NVIDIA Grace", a total of 72 Ultras can be incorporated into the rack-based computer "NVIDIA GB300 NVL72". In this system, the inference capabilities performed on the FP4 have been improved by more than 50% compared to the existing NVL72 based on the GB200.

Title: Salesforce builds an advantage with AI agents, and strategy development is being developed with AI executives
Description:
Salesforce will advance AI agents' strategies using "Agentforce," an AI agent foundation. CEO Marc Benioff is bullish, saying, "We aim to create 1 billion AI agents by 2025." The developer event held in San Francisco, USA from March 5th to 6th also set a new goal of becoming an "Agentblazer" for 1 billion people. We spoke to Adam Evans, Executive Vice President and General Manager of Salesforce AI, who spoke at the keynote speech at the event.



We spoke to Adam Evans, Executive Vice President and General Manager of AI at Salesforce. We spoke to Adam Evans, Executive Vice President and General Manager of AI at Salesforce.

--Agentforce 2dx was announced at the event. This is the second update, six months after the introduction of Agentforce. Please tell us what's behind the progress of this sudden pace.

There is a fundamental shift in technology. AI is comparable to the Internet, mobile and more, and we help our customers implement the latest AI technologies through Agentforce. That's why we are also speeding up the pitch of technological innovation.

--We have announced our goal to develop 1 billion AI agents through Agentforce by 2025. How about Progress? Also, which industry and business are the introduction of AI agents progressing?

Demand for Agentforce is strong and acceptance is also progressing. There were as many as 5,000 contracts in one quarter. It's progressing in all industries. So far, there has been a lot of customer service, but a wide range of AI agents have appeared in the long tail.

We thought that strictly regulated industries such as healthcare, which has high hurdles to implement AI, would be a challenge. We incorporate "Trust Layer," which has functions such as using data within appropriate guardrails (commonly known as functions that ensure proper use in line with security and compliance), and by using search extension generation (RAG), we achieve accurate and reliable solutions. Pfizer and CaixaBank (spanish banks) have already used Agentforce.

In the US, 1-800 Accountant, a leading accounting service for small and medium-sized businesses, has created an agent that automates the answers to tax questions for the busy season of the tax return, with a resolution rate of 50%. We also use it on the help page, and the resolution rate has reached 83%. In many cases, it quickly achieves a resolution rate of 30% and 40%, expanding the scope of application of AI agents.

Agentforce 2dx now works in the background, allowing you to make long inferences and build proactive agents with asynchronous nature.

--What kind of help Salesforce helps increase the resolution rate of AI agents to questions from customers and others?

There are various approaches to improving resolution rates. The important thing is to focus on "What problem are you trying to solve?"

At this event, we announced the new Agentforce feature, "Interaction Explorer." It is a function like observability that observes the implementation of Agentforce, allowing you to check whether it is functioning properly, what you are talking about in conversations with customers, and more. You can understand whether it is generating a return on investment (ROI) or whether it is generating value.

Another thing you can do to improve the resolution rate is to visualize the percentage of things you can't do. It helps you look at the long tail (in use cases) that AI agents can't handle and think about where to invest.

This falls into a business problem. You will decide how far you want Agentforce to go, where to deploy it, whether you should spend time on areas that cannot be resolved, and whether you should focus on building AI agents that optimize other parts.

Title: Taylor offers "Omakase ERP" in Japan--Customable Business App with Short Delivery
Description:
On March 21st, Tailor Technologies began offering the enterprise application "Omakase ERP" in Japan.

Since 2022, the company has deployed "Headless ERP," which links modules based on an API, and has been providing business applications in the ERP field that are characterized by API-first, flexibility, and modularization. By combining this with its own front-end development platform, Fabrix, it is said that it is possible to provide applications with easy-to-use user interfaces in a short period of time without compromising the flexibility of Headless ERP.

By combining the automatic front-end generation technology cultivated at Fabrix with Headless ERP, Omakase ERP offers custom ERP applications with an easy-to-use user interface in a short time. Displayed items and filtering conditions can be personalized for each department or role. In addition, both standard and customization functions are compatible with Model Context Protocol (MCP), allowing for collaboration with AI agents made by other companies and customization development using AI without any additional work on the development side.

It uses a composable design that allows you to freely combine modules from a wide range of fields, including sales management, inventory management, and production management. All functions are provided as standard as secure APIs, allowing them to be linked with other systems without additional development. Furthermore, all processes are defined, managed and executed on the Tailor Platform, reducing the burden on system administrators and ensuring high scalability.

The expected target is medium-sized and large companies over 50 billion yen in annual sales, and prices are estimated individually.

Tailor Technologies is a company headquartered in San Francisco, California, USA. Taylor, a Japanese subsidiary, was founded in July 2021.

Title: Ricoh and Sompo Japan begin joint development of multimodal LLM
Description:
Ricoh and Sompo Japan will jointly develop a private, multimodal large-scale language model (LLM) suitable for insurance services. It will be carried out under the "GENIAC" project, carried out by the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry and the New Energy and Industrial Technology Development Organization (NEDO). It was announced on March 21st.

Multimodal LLM is an AI technology that can process multiple formats (multimodal) data such as text, images, audio, and video at once. GENIAC is a coined word that is the initials of "Generative AI Accelerator Challenge" and is intended to strengthen the development capabilities of generator AI.

Ricoh is working on developing multimodal LLMs for Japanese companies. The company aims to promote innovation creation by efficiently utilizing documents and reports made up of various formats of data, including text, diagrams, tables, and images, which exist within the company.

Sompo Japan is currently running a trial run of the Oshison LLM system, a system that teaches insurance business regulations, manuals, Q&A data, and automatically generates the best answer proposals for inquiries from both inside and outside the company. The materials covered include many complex diagrams and charts. Many Japanese documents and reports have their own formats, and in some cases, existing LLMs cannot provide highly accurate answers, and the accuracy of data-based answer generation is the challenge.

The project will teach a manual that includes diagrams and charts that list insurance underwriting regulations held by Sompo Japan, and will jointly develop a private, multimodal LLM suitable for the company's insurance business. We aim to reduce the time in inquiries response operations based on actual data and use cases. After collaborative development of the model, performance verification will be carried out. In the future, we are considering developing the model while expanding the data and use cases that are targeted.

Title: SCSK and JDSC provide AI supply chain management data infrastructure for manufacturing
Description:
On March 21, SCSK and JDSC announced that they will provide the SuccessChain for DataPlatform, a data infrastructure service for manufacturing, which aggregates and visualizes data distributed across each supply chain business system, and supports solving problems using AI technology.

The new service combines SCSK's experience in building systems for the manufacturing industry with knowledge of JDSC's AI-based demand forecasting solutions, and jointly develops problem-solving data infrastructure and solutions specialized in the manufacturing industry's supply chain.

The data infrastructure allows users to use pre-prepared scenarios and data models to aggregate data distributed across different departments and processes in a short amount of time, allowing users to view the entire supply chain from data to visualize business issues, and to investigate the root causes of the issues.

In the service, both companies provide consulting. Here, we investigate DX levels for each site using the "Manufacturing Field DX Degree Check" published by the Information Technology Promotion Agency (IPA). Diagnose the level of data utilization across the customer's enterprise and clarify business issues. We also use hearing sheets to build a multi-cloud-compatible foundation and data utilization templates that can be implemented in as little as one month. Both companies will also support subsequent operations.

We also offer "Quick Infrastructure Service" and "Quick Content Services." Quick Infrastructure As Code (IaC) is a data utilization platform that supports Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud, Microsoft's Azure, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, Snowflake, and more. Quick Content Services provides scenarios and data models that meet the business challenges unique to the manufacturing industry. Users will know what to do right away. As of April, we will first prepare "inventory adjustment," "building optimal supply chain," "improvement of product value," and "improvement of quality." The source system and data utilization infrastructure will be linked with Informatica to make it possible to utilize Informatica's data catalog.

Please inquire about service charges. SCSK is expected to be introduced to 50 companies by March 2030.
